channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2024050011
item.description:
Report E-2024050011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-27
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon metal drum containing SILQUEST TEOS PURE SILANE Tetraethoxysilane. The puncture came from a nail in a pallet and resulted in an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’x5’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and overpacked the damaged drum. One drum of waste was generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024041477
item.description:
Report X-2024041477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON DOOR IN THE UNLOAD SECTION. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT CORROSIVE LEAKING PACKAGE SITTING ON THE BACK SHELVE AREA OF THE SORT AISLE. RESPONDER PLACED ALL DAMAGED CONTENTS IN A DMN PLASTIC LINED TRAY FOLLOWING DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS PROCEDURES. DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO DMN AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024040618
item.description:
Report E-2024040618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 12, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of chromium trioxide anhydrous were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. The two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails were over-packed into two separate 55-gallon drums. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents and neutralizer to the chromium trioxide anhydrous-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.
